results.title: Tour of duty
results.creator_credit: Paul Rayment, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While he saw it as his duty to defend his country against communism, it wasn’t until Paul Rayment went to Vietnam that he realised how lucky Australia really was. However, on his return, Rayment became estranged from his community and friends, and it took a while to rebuild those ties and his connection to the country he had earlier set out to defend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Rayment, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Racconti: La Voce del popolo = The Voice of the people
results.brief_description:
Racconti: La Voce Del Popolo (The Voice of the People) is a powerful living memory and dedication to the lives of hard working Australian/Italians and celebrates the enormous contribution they have made to this country.
Through the Digital storytelling program at the Australian Centre for Moving Image (ACMI) the 10 storytellers were guided through the telling of a personal story using multimedia tools. The participants used their voice as narrative and combined the audio-visual resources of their personal archives (photographs, video footage, text, music and sound) and each storyteller has produced a 3 - 5 minute digital story that explores their experiences of migration and settlement.
Racconti: La Voce Del Popolo (the Voice of the People) was made possible through the partnership of the Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF) and the Australian Centre for the Moving Image (ACMI) with the support of the Victorian Multicultural Commission.

results.title: Didgeridoo in Deutschland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Take an Aboriginal musician and an Australian composer … put them in the middle of Europe and what have you got? If the composer is George Dreyfus, the musician is Richard Walley, poet and exponent of the didgeridoo, and the European country is Germany, you get a fascinating look at two individuals whose people have been persecuted but whose vastly different cultures can come together in a totally satisfying work. Made with the assistance of the Department of Aboriginal Affairs.

results.title: One Man's Walk
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Mitchell, Interplay Theatre and First Light
results.brief_description: A boy walks down a street. We do not see his face. He is the event but we don’t know why. He tells us his likes and dislikes as he passes through the streets of his town. Finally we see his face and understand.

results.title: The Brother from Another Planet
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi, Peggy Rajski and A-Train Films
results.brief_description: An alien spaceship, piloted by a runaway slave from a distant planet, crash lands in New York harbour. From it emerges a bedraggled, bewildered extra-terrestrial. Alone in New York, he is fair game for shysters, pushers and hookers - but worse is yet to come when two intergalactic bounty hunters beam down to recapture him. Writer/Director Sayles humorously mirrors modern society through the innocent eyes of this alien brother.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi, Peggy Rajski and A-Train Films

results.title: The Provincial connection
results.brief_description: Giancarlo came to Melbourne on board a ship in 1965 at the age of 15 and started work. By the age of 21 he had bought his first house. Giancarlo is now the president of the Ballarat Italian Association and celebrates “the positive contribution of Italians to Australia”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: A meeting of ways
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Describes the process of organising a community art project for a newly-opened community centre in Melbourne called Ross House. This program records the joys, the frustrations, the tears, the highs and the lows in the making of community art.

results.title: Peaches are a lustful fruit
results.brief_description: In 1960, when Domenic was 10, his father left Italy for Australia to work in Cobram. A year later Domenic followed with his mother and sisters. ” I never went to school in Australia so my voyage from Italy was the end of my childhood” Domenic’s story represents that of the many migrant workers who have helped build Australian agriculture. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Old Songs in a New Land: A Piece of Jewish Australian ...
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Inspired by an exhibition of the same name held at Hyde Park Barracks, Sydney 1988 and organised by the Bicentennial Committee, NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, this video portrays the history of the Jews in Australia from those who arrived on the First Fleet to the Jewish immigrants from Russia of the present day. Interviews with representatives of the Jewish community highlight the differences which still exist within the community which yet retains a distinctively Jewish character.

results.title: My Grandma
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Taylor, Smith and Watson Productions, Wide Eyed and First Light
results.brief_description: Jamie is a girl who just wants to enjoy herself. However, she is constantly called upon to care for her demanding Grandmother. She is tired of hearing tales of Grandma’s childhood whilst missing out on her own. Successfully demonstrating the difference between two generations of women, will her Grandma’s constant nagging and complaining push Jamie too far?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Taylor, Smith and Watson Productions, Wide Eyed and First Light
